comments.html: Does the router ID have to be an IP that's assigned to an interface?  If we used 1.1.1.1 does there have to be an interface with that IP assigned to it?
comments.name: Jeff

comments.html: No, the OSPF router-ID is a 32-bit quantity that has to be unique throughout the OSPF domain. Cisco has long tied it to an active interface, but you can configure it manually with the "router-id" configuration command.
